column1: It can cause breathing problems due to swelling (inflammation) in the baby's lungs after birth.

Risk factors that may cause stress on the baby before birth include: - "Aging" of the placenta if the pregnancy goes far past the due date - Decreased oxygen to the infant while in the uterus - Diabetes in the pregnant mother - Difficult delivery or long labor - High blood pressure in the pregnant mother
- Bluish skin color (cyanosis) in the infant - Difficulty breathing (the infant needs to work hard to breathe) - No breathing or rapid breathing - Limpness in infant at birth
The infant may need help with breathing or heartbeat right after birth, and may have a low Apgar score.
A chest x-ray may show patchy or streaky areas in the infant's lungs.
If the baby is not breathing or has a low heart rate, the team will help the baby breathe using a face mask attached to a bag that delivers an oxygen mixture to inflate the baby's lungs.
